intro: Tithymalus cerebrinus, commonly known as the brain tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Tithymalus cerebrinus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
